page.title: 05ROADSIDE STUDIES (CONT.)
page.content:
We also collected samples of { {Woody-stemmed plants}from the hedges. We had 675 samples of these and the results are:
Ivy 56.1% Bramble 17.2% Sycamore 7.3% Dogrose 5.3% Hawthorn 4.3% Elderberry 3.7% Honeysuckle 0.9% Dogwood 0.7% Hazel 0.7% Ash 0.7% Fieldmaple 0.6% Bryony 0.6% Willow 0.4% Privet 0.3% Old Mans Beard 0.3% Wayfaring Tree 0.3% Beech 0.1% Elm 0.1% Blackthorn 0.1% These results are from little used roads so the distribution is probably little affected by lead in petrol and the salt applied to icy roads. It is thought that seeds are carried a long way in the slipstreams of vehicles.
